channel.title: USB DVD-R Drive Wont Read
channel.description:
I fhking hate my computer.
Yesterday, I was happily playing BF2 using the DVD-R USB disk drive (Because my crapp computer doesn't have one in-built), and today, it doesn't read from it. It gives me some gay error:
[code]Windows cannot read from this disk. The disk might be corrupted, or it could be using a format that is not compatible with Windows.[/code]
WTF. Gates can go die for all I care, I just wanna play BF2.
The only think I can remember that would possible affect it was change my boot sequence, but I shouldn't think that would make a difference.
Update - Uninstalled the drivers, and now Windows doesn't even see it in My Computer...I thought it auto installs the drivers..

item.title: USB DVD-R Drive Wont Read
item.dc:creator: @sup000 sup000
item.description:
@sup000 wrote:

do the installed drivers seem to relate to the device?

Ricght Click My Computer > Properties > Hardware > Device manager

look for the drive and check the driver details. Also list here the make and driver used

Read full topic

item.title: USB DVD-R Drive Wont Read
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

Ok, back from restart. It is recognised in my computer, but it is giving me that error again. ‘Disk is not formatted’.

Read full topic

item.title: USB DVD-R Drive Wont Read
item.dc:creator: @goatee goatee
item.description:
@goatee wrote:

Shouldn’t this be in questions.

Read full topic

item.title: USB DVD-R Drive Wont Read
item.dc:creator: @Mr.Chris Mr.Chris
item.description:
@Mr.Chris wrote:

sup000:

unplug, restart w/o the device. shut down and plug in before starting back up. Windows will auto install the drivers if they are avalible ‘freshly’ this way. Also did other disks work in the drive other than th game you were having problems with?

Nope, no disks worked in it at all. I’ll restart now, thanks

Read full topic
